messages.subject: Unschooling article--kids interviewed
messages.msgSnippet: My family was at this campout and two of my kids are in the photo, far left top and bottom.  Just wanted to share a good unschooling article with quotes from
messages.messageBody:
My family was at this campout and two of my kids are in the photo,
far left top and bottom. Just wanted to share a good unschooling article
with quotes from unschooled kids/teens and parents. ~Kathy


Hey campers!

Many of you talked to the UC Santa Cruz reporter who was doing the
article about unschooling. Well, here's the link to the article:

http://cityonahillpress.com/article.php?id=1037

I thought it was pretty darn good except for one slightly mangled
quote from me and the fact that she painted HSC and the campout as an
unschooler's gathering. I sent her a clarification (see below). (I
thought I had made it clear that it was a homeschoolers campout but
there would be many unschoolers there but I guess that got lost. I
was just excited that we'd be in her neck of the woods and she could
interview people in person.)

Pam

>Subject: Re: unschooling article
>
>Thanks Rachel! I've read lots of articles on unschooling and yours
>was one of the best I've ever seen! You really captured the essence
>and the enthusiasm of unschooling.
>
>One little clarification for the benefit of the Homeschool
>Association of California that sponsored the campout: HSC is not an
>unschooling organization but a support organization for all
>homeschoolers in CA and while many of the families there were
>unschoolers, it wasn't specifically an unschoolers gathering. HSC
>can be a little touchy about that!
>
>But thanks for the fabulous article. It's great that you quoted so
>many kids. Did the article come out yesterday? Please let me know
>if there's any feedback or letters to the editor. Sometimes people
>have strong reactions!
>
>Pam
>
>At 07:03 AM 2/14/2008, you wrote:
>>Here is a link to the article on Unschooling. Thank you all very
>>much for your help- I wish I could have made it longer!
>>
>>Take care,
>>
>>Rachel
>>
>>http://cityonahillpress.com/article.php?id=1037
>>
>>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
